content: There a good game buried here in these bad controls please fix the controls the jump is delayed by a micro sec making it inpossbal to jump so I can't even clear levels because of it fix them asp once you do I'll give you 5 stars.

First of all, I absolutely love this series with my whole heart and I really looked forward to finally getting this third installment of the game. but it's pretty laggy, I can't finnish a level and it's kinda frustrating, I still love it though

I am very disappointed with the experience I had with this game. I swapped over to the mobile version of this game because I could not draw at all on the switch version. It was not detecting any touch inputs on the screen. Thankfully the mobile version does work, albeit is rather laggy and didn't work at first... the templates failed to load properly and had no way of erasing the parts that were supposed to be transparent. Until they fix the level and draw lag please don't get this. I'm sorry.

I have been a fan of this series since the beginning, and I was beyond excited to learn of this sequel! The controls are hard to get used to, and make the puzzles more difficult, but everything else about this game is amazing! Personally, I prefer the Switch and Steam versions of this game, but this is still a really solid version of the game!
Plays well but on the third level it starts overheating and lagging to the point of being unplayable. It's horribly optimized on Android and that really should be fixed.
Pog game, play the ones on the ds also 10/10 i wanna kiss jowee

I loved the first two games in the Drawn To Life series. Although the controls for the mobile version is a bit odd, you can use controllers from what I heard. Drawing is a bit harder due to having no zoom in and out option, but the templates are very pretty and nice to look at if you don't want to draw all the time. The songs are very good too!

As someone who played the first two games on DS as a kid, I saw this come out and bought it immediately. The game is enjoyable so far but I do have a few complaints. Drawing is a bit clunky, I wish there was a zoom function to do able to fill and draw pixel perfect. I wish story missions would save your place, for example I exited during the mission after Heather and I was kicked all the way back and had to do the Heather levels all over again. Gameplay is kind of glitchy at times. Overall, 3/5.

A fantastic, fun game that is the perfect follow-up in the Drawn to Life franchise. Considering the depth of this game and the amount of story woven in, it is amazing to think that they've fit it all on mobile - and got it to play perfectly too.
